Title: Experimental Pharmacology
Author: ভাবনা শ্রীভাস্তভা
Summary:
This book aims at gillding the students in performing various experiments. Besides. it
also provides a comprehensive understanding of the statistical methods commonly used.
This has to be complemented with methodical recording of the observations made
during the experimental designs and discussions among the observers and teachers.

Book_Title: Manual of Practical Microbiology and Parasitology

Immunology, Serology, and Automated Methods. The inclusion of the top

Title: Microbiology In Nursing
Author: আর পাঞ্জারাথিনাম
Summary:
This book has been brought our to serve the nursing students of the country by covering
the syllabi of all Indian universities as also the Nursing Council of India, New Delhi. Much
importance has been given to the application of the knowledge of Microbiology in nursing
in hospital communicable disease unit, operation theatre, delivery room and in public health
under Indian conditions. The book has been generously illustrated to further help the students
in learning the subject.

Title: Practical Pathology
Author: প্রণবস্বার চক্রবর্তী
Summary:
A handbook of practical manual meant for medical students (undergraduates and
postgraduates) and laboratory technicians. This book contains Clinical Pathology.
Haematology, Macroscopic and Microscopic Pathology, Cytopathology, FNA. Illustrated
with several hundred colour plates and figures explaining the basic facts and principles.
clearly and briefly.

Title: Practical Pathology
Author: এন. সি. দে
Summary:
The book is meant for undergraduate medical students. It includes Morbid Anatomy and
Histopathology, Clinical Pathology, and Chemical Pathology including the principles of
Photoelectric colorimeter and Flame phorometer. Common routine microchemical techniques
for biochemical estimations have been incorporated in this book.

Author: তপন কুমার দে
Summary:
This book is very much up to date with results from modern researches in microbiology
and immunogenetics. The basic facts of bacteriology including some aspects of virology
have been presented in a simple and comprehensive fashion. The book is profusdy il
Book_Title: Medical Bactriology (Including Medical Mycology And Aids)
Book_Author: Tapon Kumar Dey,N. C. Dey ,D. Sinha

Title: Manual Of Long and Short Case In Surgery
Author: শঙ্কর প্রসাদ সেনগুপ্ত
Summary:
The subject of surgery is widening its spectrum daily as recent invasive investigations and
consequent therapeutic advancements are being introduced regularly. Unfortunately all the
recent techniques and methodologies are not mentioned in a single book. This is where
this book comes handy as it is a concise but useful aid to clinical surgery students.
It is a common pattern of books on surgery to describe every detail of disease starting ftom
etiology to management. This makes it difficult for srudents to integrate textbook description
and clinical observation to provisionally diagnose a disease.
So, this manual is basically aimed to help srudents grasp the solution of problems of short
and long cases during the examinations as well as practical field of training and practice.
Book_Title: Manual Of Long and Short Case In Surgery

Title: MCQ's in Pharmacology
Author: প্রভীন  ভুগরা
Summary:
The Medical Council of India in their latest recommendations on the medical education
and examination have stipulated that part of the question paper should be MCQ based.
This book would fulfil the requirement of the Medical Council of India stipulation.
Though it is not a substitute for the basic education in Pharmacology, it can immensely
help a student in the self-learning process. The students of Medicine, Pharmacy, Dentistry,
and Nursing will be benefited by this book.

Title: Quintessence Of Medical Pharmacology
Author: সুজিত কুমার চৌধুরী
Summary:
Modern tendencies are to (i) emphasise molecular and cellular level pharmacology
(ii) integrate pathogenesis, symptomatology with pharmacology (iii) use plenty of flow
charts, tables, and other visual aids, and (iv) avoid wordiness without losing lucidity. In
this book you will fmd all of them. Pathogenesis of the diseases including physiological
and biochemical background (recall the old age, \'difference between physiology and
pharmacology is only political\'), nationality of using the drugs in such diseases, the list
of drugs against individual diseases (in tabular form) have all been brilliandy presented.

Title: Pharmaceutical Microbiology
Author: আশুতোষ কর
Summary:
Introduction and Scope
    Structure and Function: Bacterial Cells
    Characterization, Classification and Taxonomy of Microbes
    Identification of Microoganisms
    Nutrition, Cultivation and Isolation: Bacteria- Actinomycetes- Fungi-Viruses
    Microbial Genetics and Variations
    Microbial Control by Physical and Chemical Methods
    Sterility Testing: Pharmaceutical Products
    Immune Systems
    Microbiological  (Microbial) Assays: Antibiotics 
-Vitamins - Amino Acids.

Summary:
It is a textbook, written in a compact manner. for the undergraduate and postgraduate
students, giving the details of the latest information in the field of ENT diseases. Innumerable
visuals, an added attraction of the book, would help the students in learning the subject
with its clinical and other aspectS. The book would also be useful for the practitioners.

Title: Fundamentals of Human Genetics
Author: সুমিত্র কুমার মন্ডল
Summary:
Fundamentals of Human Genetics
It is known to the readers of human genetics that, genetics as a whole is a vast subject and has
been expanding rapidly over time. Much of the expansion is due to the direct result of
developmem in human molecular genetics, in particular of protocols for gene cloning and
expression which resulted in recem procedure for identification, cloning sequencing, and
expression of genes for proteins ranging in function from metabolic enzymes and structural
proteins to membrane receptors and regulatory proteins.
In this edition, the author has given a better understanding of the structure of human genome.
As we know genetics is in a major way entwined with medicine. The book mainly and
comprehensively provides the problem of clinical genetics. Similarly, latest techniques such as
pedigree analysis, chromosome bonding are also included here. Lastly it is a cost-effective,
beneficial treatise for the students, in comparison to other costly books available in the market.
